this would be in client.java if its what your looked for probaly not now that I look at it.

if (uid > 1) server.bannedUid.add(new Integer(uid)); isKicked = true; break; }

for the socket == null idk I’m guessing it might be in the run() in your server class? Sorry if I’m wrong.

item.title: What class handles this
item.dc:creator: @reverce reverce
item.description:
@reverce wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:94, topic:288886”]The anti-null and anti AGF is easy:

In whatever class handles logins…

if(clientUID == 0) {//AGF returnCode = 11; bannedIPs.add(socket.getInetAddress().getHostAddress); disconnected = true; }

and then, in your server.java, or whichever one handles socket connections…

if(socket == null) { socket.close(); return; }

Shouldn’t be that hard. works for me.[/quote]

somone posted this, but i fergot what handles what,
can anyone help me with that?
thank you anyway !!

Read full topic
